member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a world clutter with default properties.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.invalidate
member.summary: Invalidates all world clutter cells. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.invalidate(Unigine.Math.WorldBoundBox)
member.summary: Invalidates all world clutter cells within the area specified by the given bounding box. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
member.param: Bounding box, defining the area, where world clutter cells will be regenerated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaskImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image},bool)
member.summary: Sets an image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of meshes.
member.param: Pointer to the image.
Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all world clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
member.returns: 1 if the mask image is successfully set; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaskImage(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Image}) const
member.summary: Writes the image that is currently used as a mask for the placement of meshes into the given buffer.
member.param: Image buffer to store a mask into.
member.returns: 1 if the mask image is successfully written into the buffer; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaskImageName(char,bool)
member.summary: Sets the name of a new mask image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of meshes.
member.param: Name (path) of the mask image.
Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all world clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaskImageName const
member.summary: Returns the name of a mask image (in R8 format) that defines the placement of reference nodes.
member.returns: Name (path) of the mask image.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaskMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},bool)
member.summary: Sets a mesh to be used as a mask on-the-fly. Limitations: Before the method is called, another mesh must be set via setMaskMeshName() first. If the world is reloaded, the mesh set via setMaskMeshName() will be loaded. If the memory limit is exceeded, the new mesh might be replaced with the mesh set via setMaskMeshName().
member.param: Pointer to the mesh.
Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all world clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.
member.returns: 1 if the mesh is set successfully; otherwise - 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaskMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}) const
member.summary: Copies the current mask mesh (if it exists) to the specified target mesh.
member.param: Pointer to the mesh to copy the current mask mesh to.
member.returns: 1 if mesh mask exists; otherwise - 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaskMeshName(char,bool)
member.summary: Sets a mesh to be used as a mask for the world clutter. This mesh should be plane.
member.param: Path to the *.mesh file.
Invalidate flag. Set true to invalidate all world clutter cells; otherwise, set false. All invalidated cells will be regenerated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaskMeshName const
member.summary: Returns the name (path) of the current mesh used as a mask for the world clutter. This mesh should be plane.
member.returns: Path to the *.mesh file.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMaxScale(float,float)
member.summary: Sets the scale for meshes in the areas with high density (according to the mask). With the minimum scale it is possible to automatically render, for example, big trees in the center of the forest. A spread value enables to control the range of scales relative to the mean value.
member.param: Scale mean value.
Maximum spread value to randomly upscale or downscale objects.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaxScaleMean const
member.summary: Returns the scale mean value for meshes in the areas with high density (according to the mask).
member.returns: Scale mean value.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMaxScaleSpread const
member.summary: Returns the scale spread value that controls the range of mesh scales in the areas with high density (according to the mask).
member.returns: Scale spread value.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setMinScale(float,float)
member.summary: Sets the scale for meshes in the areas with low density (according to the mask). With the minimum scale it is possible to automatically render, for example, small trees at the forest border. A spread value allows to control the range of scales relative to the mean value.
member.param: Scale mean value.
Maximum spread value to randomly upscale or downscale objects.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMinScaleMean const
member.summary: Returns the scale mean value for meshes in the areas with low density (according to the mask).
member.returns: Scale mean value.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getMinScaleSpread const
member.summary: Returns the scale spread value that controls the range of mesh scales in the areas with low density (according to the mask).
member.returns: Scale spread value.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setNodesRotation(Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Sets the rotation of reference nodes along X, Y and Z axes.
member.param: Mean values of rotation angles in degrees.
Spread values of rotation angles in degrees.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getNodesRotationMean const
member.summary: Returns the mean value of reference nodes rotation along X, Y and Z axes.
member.returns: Mean values of rotation angles in degrees.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getNodesRotationSpread const
member.summary: Returns the spread value of reference nodes rotation along X, Y and Z axes.
member.returns: Spread values of rotation angles in degrees.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setOffset(float,float)
member.summary: Sets the vertical offset that determines the placement of reference nodes above or below the surface.
member.param: Mean value of the offset in units.
Spread value of the offset in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getOffsetMean const
member.summary: Returns the current mean value of the vertical offset that determines the placement of reference nodes above or below the surface.
member.returns: Mean value of the offset in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getOffsetSpread const
member.summary: Returns the current spread value of the vertical offset that determines the placement of reference nodes above or below the surface.
member.returns: Spread value of the offset in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setReferenceName(int,char)
member.summary: Sets the name of the specified reference node contained in the world clutter.
member.param: The number of the reference node.
Name to be updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getReferenceName(int) const
member.summary: Returns the name of the reference node contained in the world clutter.
member.param: The number of the reference node among contained in the world clutter.
member.returns: Name of the reference node.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setReferenceProbability(int,float)
member.summary: Sets the probability of the occurrence of the specified node reference.
member.param: The number of the reference node.
Probability factor. The provided value is saturated in range [0;1].

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.getReferenceProbability(int) const
member.summary: Returns the probability of the occurrence of the specified node reference.
member.param: The number of the reference node.
member.returns: Probability factor.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.setSeed(int)
member.summary: Sets the seed for pseudo-random positioning of reference nodes.
member.param: Number used to initialize a pseudo-random sequence. If a negative value is provided, 0 will be used instead.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.addReference(char)
member.summary: Adds a new reference node to the world clutter.
member.param: Name of the reference node.
member.returns: The number of added reference node.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.removeReference(int)
member.summary: Removes the specified reference node from the world clutter.
member.param: The number of the reference node.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: World type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.clearReferences
member.summary: Deletes all reference nodes from the world clutter.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.saveStateReferences(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream}) const
member.summary: Saves the state of all reference nodes from the world clutter to the specified stream. Example using saveStateReferences() and restoreStateReferences() methods:
member.param: Stream smart pointer.
member.returns: true if the states of all reference nodes from the world clutter were successfully saved to the specified stream; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldClutter.restoreStateReferences(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Stream})
member.summary: Restores the state of all reference nodes from the world clutter from the specified stream. Example using saveStateReferences() and restoreStateReferences() methods:
member.param: Stream smart pointer.
member.returns: true if the states of all reference nodes from the world clutter were successfully restored from the specified stream; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.WorldExpression
member.summary: Constructor. Creates an arbitrary expression to be executed.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.isCompiled const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the given expression has been compiled. It is automatically called on world load or after setExpression() is used.
member.returns: 1 if the expression has been compiled; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.setExpression(char)
member.summary: Sets the arbitrary expression to be executed. The expression passed as an argument must be wrapped with curly braces {} as they define the world expression scope.
member.param: An executable expression.
member.returns: true if the expression is set successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.getExpression const
member.summary: Returns the executable expression.
member.returns: The executable expression.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.isFunction(char,int) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the given world expression has the function with specified name and number of arguments.
member.param: The name of the function.
The number of arguments.
member.returns: true if the expression exists; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.setIFps(float)
member.summary: Sets a constant frame duration used to execute the expression. It can be used to decrease the frame rate to get higher performance. 0 means that the expression is executed at the same frame rate as the main application window.
member.param: Frame duration (inverse FPS) in seconds (1/FPS). If a too small value is provided, 1E-6 will be used instead.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.getIFps const
member.summary: Returns the current constant frame duration used to execute the expression. 0 means that the expression is executed at the same frame rate as the main application window.
member.returns: Frame duration (inverse FPS) in seconds (1/FPS).

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: World type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.setExpressionName(char)
member.summary: Loads an expression from the given file.
member.param: Expression file name.
member.returns: true if the expression is successfully loaded from the given file; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.getExpressionName const
member.summary: Returns the name of the expression file.
member.returns: Expression file name.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.setUpdateDistanceLimit(float)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the camera within which the object should be updated.
member.param: Distance from the camera within which the object should be updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldExpression.getUpdateDistanceLimit const
member.summary: Returns the distance from the camera within which the object should be updated.
member.returns: Distance from the camera within which the object should be updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluder.#ctor(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new world occluder with given dimensions.
member.param: Size of the new occluder.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluder.setBackFace(bool)
member.summary: Updates the value indicating whether the back faces of the occluder box are used instead of front faces to occlude objects' surfaces. By default, the front faces are used.
member.param: true to use the back faces of the occluder to cull surfaces; false to use the front ones.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluder.isBackFace const
member.summary: Returns the value indicating whether the back faces of the occluder box are used instead of front faces to occlude objects' surfaces. By default, the front faces are used.
member.returns: true if the back faces of the occluder are used to cull surfaces; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluder.setDistance(float)
member.summary: Updates the distance between the camera and the bounding box of the occluder, at which the occluder becomes disabled (it isn't processed by the CPU, hence it isn't rendered). By default, the inf value is used.
member.param: The distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluder.getDistance const
member.summary: Returns the current distance between the camera and the bounding box of the occluder, at which the occluder becomes disabled (it isn't processed by the CPU, hence it isn't rendered). By default, the inf value is used.
member.returns: The distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluder.setSize(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Updates the current dimensions of the world occluder box.
member.param: The occluder dimensions.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluder.getSize const
member.summary: Returns the current dimensions of the world occluder box.
member.returns: The occluder dimensions.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluder.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: World type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.#ctor
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new world occluder mesh with the default distance value.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.#ctor(char)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new world occluder mesh from the given *.mesh file.
member.param: A mesh file name.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.setDistance(float)
member.summary: Updates the distance between the camera and the bounding box of the occluder mesh, at which this occluder mesh becomes disabled (it isn't processed by the CPU, hence it isn't rendered). By default, the inf value is used.
member.param: The distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.getDistance const
member.summary: Returns the current distance between the camera and the bounding box of the occluder mesh, at which this occluder mesh becomes disabled (it isn't processed by the CPU, hence it isn't rendered). By default, the inf value is used.
member.returns: The distance in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.setMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh})
member.summary: Allows for reinitialization of the occluder mesh: the function copies a given mesh into the current mesh used for the occluder mesh.
member.param: A mesh to be copied.
member.returns: true if the mesh is copied successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.getMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh}) const
member.summary: Copies the current mesh, on which the occluder mesh is based, into the target mesh.
member.param: Target mesh.
member.returns: true if the mesh is copied successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.setMeshPath(char,bool)
member.summary: Sets a new path for the mesh, on which the occluder mesh is based and forces loading of the mesh with the new path for the current occluder mesh.
member.param: A new path to be set for the mesh.
Force flag.If true (1) is specified, the mesh with the new path will be loaded immediately.If false (0) is specified, only the mesh path will be updated.
member.returns: true (1) if:The current mesh path coincides the new path.The mesh with the new path has been loaded successfully.The force flag is set to 0.In other cases, false (0).

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.getMeshPath const
member.summary: Returns the path of the mesh, on which the occluder mesh is based.
member.returns: Mesh path.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.loadMesh(char)
member.summary: Loads a mesh for the current occluder mesh from the file. This function doesn't change the mesh name.
member.param: The mesh file name.
member.returns: true if the mesh is loaded successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.saveMesh(char) const
member.summary: Saves the mesh, on which the occluder mesh is based, into a file.
member.param: The mesh file name.
member.returns: true if the mesh is saved successfully; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldOccluderMesh.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: World type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.#ctor
member.summary: Default constructor. Creates an empty world spline graph.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.#ctor(char)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates an empty world spline graph with a given name.
member.param: World spline graph name.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.setSplineGraphName(char,bool)
member.summary: Sets the name of the world spline graph.
member.param: World spline graph name.
Force flag.If 1 is specified, the world spline graph will immediately loaded from a file.If 0 is specified, only the world spline graph name will be updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getSplineGraphName const
member.summary: Returns the name of the world spline graph.
member.returns: World spline graph name.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.loadSegmentNodes(int)
member.summary: Loads source nodes assigned to the specified spline segment immediately.
member.param: Segment index. If no segment index is specified, the method loads source nodes assigned to all segments.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.clear
member.summary: Clears the world spline graph.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.makeCurved
member.summary: Curves the world spline graph using its geodetic pivot. The spline file is saved upon completion of the curving operation. The world spline graph must be a child of a Geodetic Pivot node.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.makeFlat
member.summary: Flattens the world spline graph using its geodetic pivot. The spline file is saved upon completion of the flattening operation. The world spline graph must be a child of a Geodetic Pivot node.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.load(char)
member.summary: Loads a spline graph from the specified XML-file.
member.param: Name of the XML-file to load the spline graph from.
member.returns: true if the spline graph was successfully loaded; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.save(char)
member.summary: Saves a spline graph to the specified XML-file.
member.param: Name of the XML-file to save the spline graph to.
member.returns: true if the spline graph was successfully saved; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: WorldSplineGraph type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getSegmentNodeMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},int,bool)
member.summary: Gets a mesh used by a node with the specified index, placed along the specified spline segment, and puts it to the specified target Mesh instance.
member.param: Target mesh instance to which the obtained mesh is to be put.
Spline segment for which the mesh is to be returned.
Number of the node instance placed along the spline segment.
true to use baked mesh transformation, false - to use default (the mesh will be placed at the origin). The default value is false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getPointNodeMesh(Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Mesh},Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},int,bool)
member.summary: Exports a mesh with the specified index placed as the specified spline point to the specified target mesh. Due to the nature of the mesh, there will be visual artifacts connected with the float precision, in case an exported node is located very far from the origin (around 10,000 m and further). In this case we advise exporting it without baking transformation.
member.param: Target mesh to store the desired mesh placed at the specified spline point.
Spline point for which a mesh is to be retrieved.

Number of the desired node in a row of nodes placed at the specified point, in the range from 0 to the total number of nodes placed at the point.The node must be an ObjectMeshStatic or an ObjectMeshSkinned, otherwise an error occurs.

Bake Transform flag:true - to export the mesh preserving the current coordinates (can be useful when splitting largeWorldSplineGraph objects to keep relative positions of meshes); orfalse - to reset the position of the exported mesh to origin (0,0,0) with zero-rotation.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.createSplinePoint(Unigine.Math.Vec3)
member.summary: Creates a new spline point with the specified parameters and attaches it to the world spline graph.
member.param: Position coordinates for the new splint point.
member.returns: New spline point.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.removeSplinePoint(Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},bool)
member.summary: Removes the specified spline point from the world spline graph. You can set the merge flag to merge spline segments sharing this point as their start and end points. Segment merging is available only when the point to be removed is shared by two segments, otherwise the merge flag is ignored and all segments sharing this point are also removed.
member.param: Spline point to be removed.
true to merge spline segments sharing this point as their start and end points, false to remove all segments sharing this point. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getSplinePoints(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns the list of all points of the world spline graph and puts them to the specified vector of SplinePoint elements.
member.param: Vector to store the list of all points of the world spline graph.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.createSplineSegment(Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},Unigine.Math.vec3,Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Creates a new spline segment with the specified parameters and attaches it to the world spline graph.
member.param: Start point of the spline segment.
Tangent coordinates for the start point of the spline segment.
Coordinates of the "up" vector for the start point of the spline segment.
End point of the segment.
Tangent coordinates for the end point of the spline segment.
Coordinates of the "up" vector for the end point of the spline segment.
member.returns: New spline segment connecting two specified points.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.removeSplineSegment(Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},bool)
member.summary: Removes the specified spline segment from the world spline graph. You can set the with_points flag to remove the segment together with its start and end points.
member.param: Spline segment to be removed.
true to remove the segment with its start and end points, false to keep points. The default value is false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.getSplineSegments(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns the list of all segments of the world spline graph and puts them to the specified vector of SplineSegment elements.
member.param: Vector to store the list of all segments of the world spline graph.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.rebuild(int)
member.summary: Rebuilds the world spline graph. This method is to be called after making any changes to spline segments (mode, etc.), point positions, tangents, or "up" vectors, as well as after changing source node assignments and/or other parameters (UV tiling, gap, etc.)
member.param: Forced rebuild flag: set 1 to try and force rebuild the world spline graph.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.isRebuilding const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the world spline graph is currently being rebuilt. The world spline graph uses a deferred rebuild.
member.returns: 1 if the world spline graph is currently being rebuilt; otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.splitSplineSegment(Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},float)
member.summary: Splits the specified spline segment into two parts by inserting a new point placed at the parametrically specified point on the T (times axis) in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range from the segment's start point.
member.param: Spline segment to be split.
Coordinate of the splitting point of the segment along the horizontal T (times) axis in the range [0.0f, 1.0f].

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.breakSplinePoint(Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint})
member.summary: Breaks the specified spline point shared by several spline segments into a set of separate ones, so that each of the segments gets its own point.
member.param: Spline point to be broken.The point must be shared by a least 2 segments.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.weldSplinePoints(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator})
member.summary: Joins all spline points specified in the list into a single one, so that this point is shared by all spline segments having the specified points as starting or ending ones.
member.param: List of spline points to be joined into a single one.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSplineGraph.isLinked(Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint}) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the specified spline point is linked to any spline segment.
member.param: Spline point to be checked.
member.returns: 1 if the specified spline point is linked to any spline segment; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.setEnabled(bool,bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the spline point is enabled.
member.param: 1 to enable the spline point, 0 to disable.
Use true to enable all segments, to which the point belongs as well, false to enable the spline point only.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.isEnabled const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the spline point is enabled.
member.returns: true if the spline point is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.setPosition(Unigine.Math.Vec3)
member.summary: Sets a new position of the spline point.
member.param: New position to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getPosition const
member.summary: Returns the current position of the spline point.
member.returns: Current spline point position.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getSplineSegments(Unigine.Vector{Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns the list of segments, to which the spline point belongs, and puts them to the specified vector of SplineSegment elements.
member.param: Vector to store the list of segments, to which the spline point belongs.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.clearSources
member.summary: Clears the list of source nodes for the spline point.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.assignSource(char)
member.summary: Assigns a source node with the given name to the spline point.
member.param: Source node name.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.removeSource(char)
member.summary: Removes the source node with the given name.
member.param: Name of the source node to be removed.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getSources(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns a list of source nodes assigned to the spline point and puts it to the specified vector.
member.param: List of source nodes assigned to the spline point.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.copy(Unigine.Ptr{SplinePoint})
member.summary: Copies all parameters from the specified source spline point.
member.param: Source spline point.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.clone
member.summary: Returns a clone of the spline point.
member.returns: Clone of the spline point.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getParent const
member.summary: Returns the WorldSplineGraph node to which the spline point belongs.
member.returns: WorldSplineGraph node to which the spline point belongs.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getNumSegments const
member.summary: Returns the total number of segments sharing this spline point.
member.returns: Total number of segments sharing this spline point.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getNumSources const
member.summary: Returns the total number of source nodes assigned to this spline point.
member.returns: Total number of source nodes assigned to this spline point.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getSourceNodeType(char) const
member.summary: Returns the type of the source node with the specified name.
member.param: Source node name.
member.returns: Source node type.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.setLinkVariant(char,int)
member.summary: Sets a link variant for the junction source node with the specified name.
member.param: Source node name.
Link variant number for the junction source node.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getLinkVariant(char) const
member.summary: Returns the current link variant for the junction source node with the specified name.
member.param: Source node name.
member.returns: Link variant number for the junction source node.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getLinkWorldPosition(Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},Unigine.Math.Vec3) const
member.summary: Gets the current link (bone) position of the junction source node and puts it to the specified position vector.
member.param: Spline segment for which the position of the corresponding link (bone) of the junction source node is to be obtained.
Vector to store the position of the junction source node's link (bone) corresponding to the specified spline segment.
member.returns: 1 if the current position of the junction source node's link (bone) corresponding to the specified spline segment was obtained successfully; otherwise 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getNode(int)
member.summary: Returns a node assigned to the point by its number.
member.param: Number of the desired node in a row of nodes placed at this point, in the range from 0 to the total number of nodes placed at the point.
member.returns: Node placed at this point at the specified position (number).

member.name: M:Unigine.SplinePoint.getNumNodes const
member.summary: Returns the total number of nodes placed at this spline point.
member.returns: Total number of nodes placed at this spline point.

member.summary: Returns the current start point of the segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getEndPoint const

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getStartTangent const
member.summary: Returns the current tangent coordinates for the start point of the spline segment.

member.summary: Sets the "up" vector coordinates for the start point of the segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getStartUp const
member.summary: Returns the current "up" vector coordinates for the start point of the spline segment.

member.summary: Sets the tangent coordinates for the end point of the spline segment.

member.summary: Returns the current tangent coordinates for the end point of the spline segment.

member.summary: Sets the "up" vector coordinates for the end point of the segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getEndUp const
member.summary: Returns the current "up" vector coordinates for the end point of the spline segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.setEnabled(bool,bool)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether the spline segment is enabled.
member.param: true to enable the spline segment, false to disable.
Use true to enable all points that belong to it as well, false to enable the spline point only.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.isEnabled const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether the spline segment is enabled.
member.returns: true if the spline segment is enabled; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.calcPoint(float) const
member.summary: Returns the coordinates of the point at the parametrically specified position on the segment (along the T axis).
member.param: Position of the point on the segment, specified parametrically along the T (times axis) in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range.
member.returns: Coordinates of the point.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.calcTangent(float) const
member.summary: Returns the tangent coordinates for the point at the parametrically specified position on the segment (along the T axis).
member.param: Position of the point on the segment, specified parametrically along the T (times axis) in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range.
member.returns: Tangent coordinates for the point at the specified position on the segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.calcUpVector(float) const
member.summary: Returns the "up" vector coordinates for the point at the parametrically specified position on the segment (along the T axis).
member.param: Position of the point on the segment, specified parametrically along the T (times axis) in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range.
member.returns: Coordinates of the "up" vector for the point at the specified position on the segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.linearToParametric(float) const
member.summary: Performs conversion of linear position in accordance with the spline segment's length to parametric position (along the T axis).
member.param: Linear position on the spline segment in the range [0.0f, 1.0f].
member.returns: Parametric position of the point on the segment, along the T (times axis) in the [0.0f, 1.0f] range.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getLength const
member.summary: Returns the length of the spline segment.
member.returns: Length of the spline segment, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.clearSources
member.summary: Clears the list of source nodes for the spline segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.assignSource(char,int)
member.summary: Assigns a source node with the given name to the spline segment and sets the specified forward axis for it.
member.param: Source node name.
Forward axis to be set for the source node. One of the FORWARD_ variables. The X axis is used by default.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.removeSource(char,int)
member.summary: Removes the source node with the given name.
member.param: Name of the source node to be removed.
Forward axis for the source node. One of the FORWARD_ variables. The Y axis is used by default.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getSources(Unigine.Vector{String,int,Unigine.VectorAllocator}) const
member.summary: Returns a list of source nodes assigned to the spline segment and puts it to the specified vector.
member.param: List of source nodes assigned to the spline segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.setSegmentMode(char,int)
member.summary: Sets the segment mode for the source node with the given name.
member.param: Source node name.
Mode for the source node with the given name. One of the SEGMENT_* variables. SEGMENT_TILING is used by default.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getSegmentMode(char) const
member.summary: Returns the current segment mode for the source node with the given name.
member.param: Source node name.
member.returns: Mode for the source node with the given name. One of the SEGMENT_* variables. SEGMENT_STRETCH is used by default.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.setUVTiling(char,int)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether UV tiling for the material textures of the source node with the given name is enabled.
member.param: Source node name.
1 to enable UV tiling for the material textures of the source node, 0 - to stretch textures. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getUVTiling(char) const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating whether UV tiling for the material textures of the source node with the given name is enabled.
member.param: Source node name.
member.returns: 1 if UV tiling for the material textures of the source node is enabled; otherwise (textures are stretched), 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.setAdaptiveAngleThreshold(char,float)
member.summary: Sets the angle threshold value for splitting source node with the given name. If an angle between the tangents for the two subsequent parts of the spline segment exceeds this value, the node will be split. This parameter is used only for the SEGMENT_ADAPTIVE mode.
member.param: Source node name.
Angle threshold value for the source node with the given name, in degrees. The default value is 1.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getAdaptiveAngleThreshold(char) const
member.summary: Returns the current angle threshold value for splitting source node with the given name. If an angle between the tangents for the two subsequent parts of the spline segment exceeds this value, the node will be split. This parameter is used only for the SEGMENT_ADAPTIVE mode.
member.param: Source node name.
member.returns: Angle threshold value for the source node with the given name, in degrees. The default value is 1.0f.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.setGap(char,float)
member.summary: Sets the size of the gap between the adjacent copies of the source node with the given name tiled along the spline segment. This parameter is used only for the SEGMENT_TILING mode.
member.param: Source node name.
Gap size to be set, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getGap(char) const
member.summary: Returns the current size of the gap between the adjacent copies of the source node with the given name tiled along the spline segment. This parameter is used only for the SEGMENT_TILING mode.
member.param: Source node name.
member.returns: Current gap size, in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.copy(Unigine.Ptr{SplineSegment},int)
member.summary: Copies all parameters from the specified source spline segment.
member.param: Source spline segment.
Use 1 to copy all parameters of segment's endpoints as well, 0 to use default ones. The default value is 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.clone(int)
member.summary: Returns a clone of the spline segment.
member.param: Use 1 to copy all parameters of segment's endpoints as well, 0 to use default ones. The default value is 0.
member.returns: Clone of the spline segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getParent const
member.summary: Returns the WorldSplineGraph node to which the spline segment belongs.
member.returns: WorldSplineGraph node to which the spline segment belongs.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getNumSources const
member.summary: Returns the total number of source nodes assigned to this spline segment.
member.returns: Total number of source nodes assigned to this spline segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getNumNodes const
member.summary: Returns the total number of nodes placed along the spline segment.
member.returns: Total number of nodes placed along the spline segment.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getForwardAxis(char)
member.summary: Returns the forward axis used for the source node with the specified name.
member.param: Source node name.
member.returns: Forward axis for the source node. One of the FORWARD_ variables.

member.name: M:Unigine.SplineSegment.getNode(int)
member.summary: Returns a node assigned to the segment by its number.
member.param: Number of the desired node in a row of nodes placed along the segment in the range from 0 to the total number of nodes placed along the segment.
member.returns: Node placed along the segment at the specified position (number).

member.name: F:Unigine.SplineSegment.FORWARD_X
member.summary: X is a forward axis for stretching.

member.name: F:Unigine.SplineSegment.FORWARD_Y
member.summary: Y is a forward axis for stretching.

member.name: F:Unigine.SplineSegment.FORWARD_Z
member.summary: Z is a forward axis for stretching.

member.name: F:Unigine.SplineSegment.SEGMENT_STRETCH
member.summary: The source node is stretched along the segment. This mode is the most performance-friendly, as only a single node is created for a segment. However, the stretched geometry will cut the curves of the spline to straight lines.

member.name: F:Unigine.SplineSegment.SEGMENT_TILING
member.summary: The source node is duplicated along the segment. Selecting this mode for a large spline graph may siginficantly reduce performance, due to a large number of tiled nodes.

member.name: F:Unigine.SplineSegment.SEGMENT_ADAPTIVE
member.summary: This mode represents a combination of stretching and tiling to make the geometry placed along the spline graph look more plausible for a lower performance cost.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSwitcher.WorldSwitcher
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a world switcher.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSwitcher.setMaxDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the maximum distance of visibility. If a camera is further from a node than this maximum distance, a node is not visible. The default is inf.
member.param: Maximum distance of visibility in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSwitcher.getMaxDistance const
member.summary: Returns the current maximum distance of visibility. If a camera is further from a node than this maximum distance, a node is not visible. The default is inf.
member.returns: Maximum distance of visibility in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSwitcher.setMinDistance(float)
member.summary: Sets the minimum distance of visibility. If a camera is closer to a node than this minimum distance, a node is not visible. The default is -inf.
member.param: Minimum distance of visibility in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldSwitcher.getMinDistance const
member.summary: Returns the current minimum distance of visibility. If a camera is closer to a node than this minimum distance, a node is not visible. The default is -inf.
member.returns: Minimum distance of visibility in units.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformBone.#ctor(char)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a WorldTransformBone in the world coordinates with a specified bone name.
member.param: Name of the bone.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformBone.setBoneName(char)
member.summary: Sets the name of the bone to be used for transformation.
member.param: The name of the bone.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformBone.getBoneName const
member.summary: Returns the name of the bone used for transformation.
member.returns: The name of the bone.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformBone.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: World type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.#ctor(char,int)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a transformer defined by a path in world coordinates.
member.param: Path to the *.path file.
The dynamic flag:0 - If the path is changed in run-time, paths loaded from the same file will be also changed.1 - If the path is changed in run-time, paths loaded from the same file won't be changed

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setLoop(int)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if the transformation defined by the path should be looped.
member.param: 1 to loop the transformation defined by the path; 0 to play it only once.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getLoop const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the transformation defined by the path is looped.
member.returns: 1 if the transformation is looped; otherwise, 0.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setOrientation(int)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating if an object should be oriented along the path. When this option is enabled the complete transformation matrix (position, rotation, and scale) is taken into account when calculating intermediate transformation between the frames. When disabled - only the intermediate position between the frames is used, while keeping object's scale and rotation.
member.param: 1 to orient an object along the path; 0 to keep the initial orientation of the object. The default value is 1.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getOrientation const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if an object is oriented along the path. When this option is enabled the complete transformation matrix (position, rotation, and scale) is taken into account when calculating intermediate transformation between the frames. When disabled - only the intermediate position between the frames is used, while keeping object's scale and rotation.
member.returns: 1 if an object is oriented along the path; 0 if the object initial orientation is kept. The default value is 1.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getPath const
member.summary: Returns the path, by which the transformation is defined. By using this function, you can edit the current path or change velocity or transformation of the object moving along the path.
member.returns: Instance of the Path class.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setPathName(char,int)
member.summary: Reloads the internal path transformation.
member.param: The path name to be set.
The dynamic flag:0 - If the reloaded path is changed, paths loaded from the same file will be also changed.1 - If the reloaded path is changed, paths loaded from the same file won't be changed.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getPathName const
member.summary: Returns the name of the path, by which the transformation is defined.
member.returns: The path name.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.isPlaying const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the transformation defined by the path is played.
member.returns: true if the transformation is played; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setSpeed(float)
member.summary: Sets the speed of playback of the transformation defined by the path.
member.param: Speed of the transformation playback. Negative value controls reverse playback.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getSpeed const
member.summary: Returns the speed of playback of the transformation defined by the path.
member.returns: The playback speed.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.isStopped const
member.summary: Returns a value indicating if the transformation defined by the path is stopped.
member.returns: true if the transformation is stopped; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setTime(float)
member.summary: Sets the time, from which the playback of the transformation defined by the path starts. If the object is oriented along the path, its transformation will be correspond to the path transformation at the specified time. Otherwise, only position of the object will change.
member.param: The playback time to be set.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getTime const
member.summary: Returns the time from which the playback of the transformation defined by the path starts.
member.returns: The playback time.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.play
member.summary: Continues playback of the transformation defined by the path, if it is paused, or starts playback if it is stopped.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.stop
member.summary: Stops playback of the transformation defined by the path. This function saves the playback position so that playing of the transformation defined by the path can be resumed from the same point.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: World type identifier.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.setUpdateDistanceLimit(float)
member.summary: Sets the distance from the camera within which the object should be updated.
member.param: Distance from the camera within which the object should be updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTransformPath.getUpdateDistanceLimit const
member.summary: Returns the distance from the camera within which the object should be updated.
member.returns: Distance from the camera within which the object should be updated.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.#ctor(Unigine.Math.vec3)
member.summary: Constructor. Creates a new world trigger with given dimensions.
member.param: Dimensions of the new world trigger. If negative values are provided, 0 will be used instead of them.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.setExcludeNodes(Unigine.Set{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node}})
member.summary: Sets a list of excluded nodes, on which the world trigger will not react.
member.param: Exclude nodes vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.getExcludeNodes const
member.summary: Returns the current list of excluded nodes, on which the world trigger does not react.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.setExcludeTypes(Unigine.Set{int})
member.summary: Sets a list of excluded node types, on which the world trigger will not react.
member.param: Exclude node types vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.getExcludeTypes const
member.summary: Returns the current list of excluded node types, on which the world trigger does not react.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.getNode(int) const
member.summary: Returns a specified node contained in the world trigger.
member.param: Node number in range from 0 to the total number of nodes.
member.returns: Node pointer.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.getNodes const
member.summary: Gets nodes contained in the trigger.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.setTargetNodes(Unigine.Set{Unigine.Ptr{Unigine.Node}})
member.summary: Sets a list of target nodes, which will fire callbacks. If this list is empty, all nodes fire callbacks.
member.param: Target nodes vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.getTargetNodes const
member.summary: Returns the current list of target nodes, which fire callbacks. If this list is empty, all nodes fire callbacks.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.setTargetTypes(Unigine.Set{int})
member.summary: Sets a list of target node types, which will fire callbacks. If this list is empty, all nodes fire callbacks.
member.param: Target node types vector.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.getTargetTypes const
member.summary: Returns the current list of target node types, which fire callbacks. If this list is empty, all nodes fire callbacks.

member.name: M:Unigine.WorldTrigger.type
member.summary: Returns the type of the node.
member.returns: World type identifier.
